newsitem.title: USA: High tech still fostering Bay Area growth - SF Fed.
newsitem.headline: High tech still fostering Bay Area growth - SF Fed.

text.p: Knowledge-intensive industries which played a key role in the economic recovery of the San Francisco Bay Area are likely to continue to help foster economic growth in the region, the head of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco said.

"Clearly, knowledge-intensive industries have been fundamental to our recovery and growing economic strength. And ... they also clearly will be engines of economic growth and prosperity for the region's future," San Francisco Fed president Robert Parry said.
Parry spoke to an audience at the annual awards dinner ceremony at the School of Business of the City College of San Francisco.

Parry said the knowledge-intensive industries -- such as software development, high-tech manufacturing, multimedia and biotechnology -- "...were critical pulling the local economy out of the long recession of the early 1990's."
He added that job growth in the Bay Area is estimated to have jumped 10 percent last year, following a gain of about 15 percent in 1995.
